column4: can someone please help me with my ubunt installation. i had errors installing under most methods, but was finally able to get the oem install to work. but when it reboots it shows the loading status bar, then i get a wierd looking screen with what looks like a bunch of interlacing artifacts. the start sound plays and the screen turns black, then slowly vertical lines of color appear on the...
...sides of the monitor (gray on the left, green and red on the right).
this is starting to annoy me, ive been trying to install ubuntu on this laptop for the last 5 hours
seriously, can someone please help?
is someone here good with install issues?
can someone please help with my install issue before i smash my laptop?
saloxin:its a laptop, so its the built in display
use the second install option that ends (VGA Mode)
I don't know anything about that mode
then whats the issue ?
no idea ...
still no idea
yeah
I would do both... config now... if it gets boffed up --- reinstall and use the continue option
sometimes I've seen it not be able to config on the first install... but after its all done, the display works fine ...
I have no idea what the capabilities of your laptop are
then go for it
then tru continue next time
then I have no idea ...
ohh
you said you were trying an older version ... 7.10 is the current vs
Oh, I see, Yes, good idea
have you checked to see if your video card has any compatibility issues?
